trans-unit.source: Represents a query that tests whether a message satisfies the requirements of a specified endpoint address.
This filter tests whether a message satisfies a particular endpoint address.
An <xref:System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress> object includes a URI and an optional collection of addressing headers.
The addressing and message headers are canonicalized in order to be compared for equality.
If a parameter appears more than once in an <xref:System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress>, the corresponding header must appear in the message at least that many times.
IIS and the underlying file system (NTFS or FAT) are case-insensitive.
URI comparisons done by this class are also case-insensitive.
So, for example, http://www.microsoft.com is evaluated as equal to http://WWW.microsoft.com.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.EndpointAddressMessageFilter"></xref> class with a specified address against which to test a message.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress"></xref> against which messages are tested.
is `null`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.EndpointAddressMessageFilter"></xref> class.
If you have a web service installed on your local machine, there are many equivalent ways to reference it, including the following:
http://localhost/foo.svc
http://[my-machine-name]/foo.svc
http://[my-machine-name].[my-company].com/foo.svc.
If the value of the `includeHostNameInComparison` parameter is `false`, the above URIs all resolve to the same endpoint.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress"></xref> against which messages are tested.
`true` if the host name is included in the endpoint address comparison; otherwise, `false`.
is `null`.
Gets the address that the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.EndpointAddressMessageFilter"></xref> tests messages against.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress"></xref> that the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.EndpointAddressMessageFilter"></xref> tests messages against.
Creates a new filter table that tests a message against multiple endpoint addresses simultaneously.
The method returns an instance of <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.IMessageFilterTable%601> that is optimized to test for specific message endpoints.
This method is intended to be used by <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.MessageFilterTable%601>.
Use <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.IMessageFilterTable%601> constructors to create filter table instances.
Data associated with the filters in the table.
An object that implements the interface that can contain s with associated FilterData.
Gets a value that indicates whether the host name is included in the endpoint address comparison.
If you have a web service installed on your local machine, there are many equivalent ways to reference it, including the following:
http://localhost/foo.svc
http://[my-machine-name]/foo.svc
http://[my-machine-name].[my-company].com/foo.svc.
The default value of this property is `false`, so the above URIs all resolve to the same endpoint, unless you change this property.
`true` if the host name is included in the endpoint address comparison; otherwise, `false`.
Tests whether a message satisfies the specified endpoint address.
The two overloads of this method are equivalent because they both examine only message headers.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message"></xref> object to test.
`true` if the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message"></xref> object satisfies the endpoint address specified in the filter; otherwise, `false`.
message is `null`.
Tests whether a buffered message satisfies the specified endpoint address.
The two overloads of this method are equivalent because they both examine only message headers.
The only reason to use this overload is if you already had a `messageBuffer` available and not a message, because this method converts the `messageBuffer` into a message.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageBuffer"></xref> object to test.
`true` if the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageBuffer"></xref> object satisfies the endpoint address; otherwise, `false`.
messageBuffer is `null`.
